com.github.wuic.engine.core
Class TextInspectorEngine

java.lang.Object
  com.github.wuic.engine.Engine
      com.github.wuic.engine.NodeEngine
          com.github.wuic.engine.core.TextInspectorEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
NutFilterHolder, Comparable<Engine>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CssInspectorEngine, JavascriptInspectorEngine
public abstract class TextInspectorEngine
extends NodeEngine
implements NutFilterHolder

Basic inspector engine for text nuts processing text line per line. This kind of engine inspects each nut of a request to eventually alter their content or to extract other referenced nuts thanks to a set of inspectors.

Since:
0.3.3
Version:
1.5
Author:
Guillaume DROUET

inspect

protected Nut inspect(Nut nut,
                      EngineRequest request)
               throws WuicException

Extracts from the given nut all the nuts referenced by the @import statement in CSS.

This method is recursive.

Parameters:
nut - the nut
request - the initial request
Returns:
the nut corresponding the inspected nut specified in parameter
Throws:
WuicException - if an I/O error occurs while reading

inspectLine

protected String inspectLine(String line,
                             EngineRequest request,
                             LineInspector inspector,
                             List<Nut> referencedNuts,
                             NutsHeap nutsHeap,
                             Nut original)
                      throws WuicException

Inspects the given line and eventually adds some extracted nuts to the nut referencing it.

This method is recursive.

Parameters:
line - the line to be inspected
request - the initial request
inspector - the inspector to use
referencedNuts - the collection where any referenced nut identified by the method will be added
nutsHeap - the heap wrapping the DAO to use
original - the inspected nut
Returns:
the given line eventually transformed
Throws:
WuicException - if an I/O error occurs while reading

works

public Boolean works()

Returns a flag indicating if the engine is configured to do something or not.

Specified by:
works in class Engine
Returns:
true is something will be done, false otherwise
